12 times over three days"},{"time":350708,"text":"to mimic repeated risk exposures."},{"time":353583,"text":"A control panel on the EEG headset"},{"time":356083,"text":"measured their various
emotional responses:"},{"time":358750,"text":"like attention, interest,
excitement, frustration,"},{"time":362000,"text":"guilt, stress levels and relaxation."},{"time":365542,"text":"They also rated their emotions"},{"time":367125,"text":"on well-validated
emotion-measuring scales."},{"time":370375,"text":"This meant that I had measured
the process of habituation"},{"time":373250,"text":"and its effects on decision-making."},{"time":376167,"text":"And it took 29 days
to complete this research."},{"time":379292,"text":"And with months of frantically
drafting proposals,"},{"time":382542,"text":"meticulously computing data
in a caffeinated daze at 2am,"},{"time":387042,"text":"I was able to finalize my results."},{"time":389708,"text":"And the results showed
that habituation to risk-taking"},{"time":392708,"text":"could actually change a teen's brain
by altering their emotional levels,"},{"time":396875,"text":"causing greater risk-taking."},{"time":399250,"text":"The students' emotions
that were normally associated with risks,"},{"time":402917,"text":"like fear, stress, guilt and nervousness,"},{"time":406333,"text":"as well as attention,"},{"time":408000,"text":"were high when they were first
exposed to the risk simulator."},{"time":412167,"text":"This curbed their temptations
and enforced self-control,"},{"time":415667,"text":"which prevented them
from taking more risks."},{"time":418750,"text":"However, the more they were exposed
to the risks through the simulator,"},{"time":422708,"text":"the less fearful, guilty
and stressed they became."},{"time":426667,"text":"This caused a situation"},{"time":428250,"text":"in which they were no longer able to feel"},{"time":430250,"text":"the brain's natural
fear and caution instincts."},{"time":433875,"text":"And also, because they are teenagers
and their brains are still underdeveloped,"},{"time":438792,"text":"they became more interested and excited
in thrill-seeking behaviors."}]},{"cues":[{"time":443708,"text":"So what were the consequences?"},{"time":446250,"text":"They lacked self-control
for logical decision-making,"},{"time":449333,"text":"took greater risks"},{"time":451083,"text":"and made more harmful choices."},{"time":453208,"text":"So the developing brain alone
isn't to blame."},{"time":456750,"text":"The process of habituation
also plays a key role in risk-taking"},{"time":460458,"text":"and risk escalation."},{"time":462500,"text":"Although a teen's willingness to seek risk"},{"time":464917,"text":"is largely a result of the structural
and functional changes"},{"time":468167,"text":"associated with their developing brains,"},{"time":470958,"text":"the dangerous part
that my research was able to highlight"},{"time":474208,"text":"was that a habituation to risks"},{"time":476250,"text":"can actually physically
change a teen's brain"},{"time":478958,"text":"and cause greater risk-taking."},{"time":481333,"text":"So it's the combination
of the immature teen brain"},{"time":484333,"text":"and the impact of habituation"},{"time":486333,"text":"that is like a perfect storm
to create more damaging effects."},{"time":490917,"text":"And this research can help parents
and the general public"},{"time":494542,"text":"understand that teens aren't just
willfully ignoring warnings"},{"time":497708,"text":"or simply defying parents by engaging
in increasingly more dangerous behavior."},{"time":502875,"text":"The biggest hurdle they're facing
is their habituation to risks:"},{"time":506917,"text":"all the physical, detectable
and emotional functional changes"},{"time":511292,"text":"that drive and control and influence
their over-the-top risk-taking."}]},{"cues":[{"time":516667,"text":"So yes, we need policies
that provide safer environments"},{"time":520417,"text":"and limit exposures to high risks,"},{"time":523042,"text":"but we also need policies
that reflect this insight."},{"time":527458,"text":"These results are
a wake-up call for teens, too."},{"time":530500,"text":"It shows them that the natural
and necessary fear and guilt"},{"time":534000,"text":"that protect them from unsafe situations"},{"time":536875,"text":"actually become numb when they
repeatedly choose risky behaviors."}]},{"cues":[{"time":541917,"text":"So with this hope to share my findings
with fellow teenagers and scientists,"},{"time":546917,"text":"I took my research"},{"time":548250,"text":"to the Intel International
Science and Engineering Fair, or ISEF,"},{"time":552625,"text":"a culmination of over 1,800 students"},{"time":555000,"text":"from 75 countries,
regions and territories,"},{"time":558667,"text":"who showcase their cutting-edge
research and inventions."},{"time":562417,"text":"It's like the Olympics of science fair."}]},{"cues":[{"time":564917,"text":"(Laughter)"}]},{"cues":[{"time":566125,"text":"There, I was able to present my research
to experts in neuroscience and psychology"},{"time":571292,"text":"and garner valuable feedback."},{"time":573833,"text":"But perhaps the most
memorable moment of the week"},{"time":576833,"text":"was when the booming speakers
suddenly uttered my name"},{"time":580000,"text":"during the awards ceremony."},{"time":582125,"text":"I was in such disbelief
that I questioned myself:"},{"time":585458,"text":"Was this just another "La La Land" blunder"},{"time":588125,"text":"like at the Oscars?"}]},{"cues":[{"time":589417,"text":"(Laughter)"}]},{"cues":[{"time":590875,"text":"Luckily, it wasn't."},{"time":593167,"text":"I really had won first place"},{"time":595125,"text":"in the category "Behavioral
and Social Sciences.""}]},{"cues":[{"time":597667,"text":"(Applause)"}]},{"cues":[{"time":604042,"text":"Needless to say,"},{"time":605417,"text":"I was not only thrilled
to have this recognition,"},{"time":608208,"text":"but also the whole experience
of science fair that validated my efforts"},{"time":613167,"text":"keeps my curiosity alive"},{"time":615292,"text":"and strengthens my creativity,"},{"time":617292,"text":"perseverance and imagination."},{"time":620792,"text":"This still image of me
experimenting in my school library"},{"time":624542,"text":"may seem ordinary,"},{"time":626542,"text":"but to me, it represents
a sort of inspiration."},{"time":630375,"text":"It reminds me that this process
taught me to take risks."},{"time":634375,"text":"And I know that might sound
incredibly ironic."},{"time":637500,"text":"But I took risks realizing"},{"time":639458,"text":"that unforeseen opportunities
often come from risk-taking --"},{"time":643542,"text":"not the hazardous,
negative type that I studied,"},{"time":646708,"text":"but the good ones,"},{"time":648083,"text":"the positive risks."}]},{"cues":[{"time":650250,"text":"The more risks I took,"},{"time":652000,"text":"the more capable I felt of withstanding
my unconventional circumstances,"},{"time":656750,"text":"leading to more tolerance,
resilience and patience"},{"time":659625,"text":"for completing my project."},{"time":661792,"text":"And these lessons
have led me to new ideas"},{"time":664875,"text":"like: Is the opposite
of negative risk-taking also true?"},{"time":668458,"text":"Can positive risk-taking
escalate with repeated exposures?"},{"time":672458,"text":"Does positive action
build positive brain functioning?"}]},{"cues":[{"time":676667,"text":"I think I just might have
my next research idea."}]},{"cues":[{"time":680250,"text":"(Applause)"}]}]}

speaker: Eve Pearlman
title: How to lead a conversation between people who disagree
text:
{"paragraphs":[{"cues":[{"time":1208,"text":"So in the run-up to the 2016 election,"},{"time":4000,"text":"I was, like most of us,
watching the rise in discord and vitriol"},{"time":8583,"text":"and nastiness in our public spaces."},{"time":11125,"text":"It was this crazy uptick in polarization."},{"time":14625,"text":"It was both disheartening and distressing."},{"time":18375,"text":"And so I started thinking,
with a fellow journalist, Jeremy Hay,"},{"time":21458,"text":"about how we might practice
our craft differently."},{"time":24792,"text":"How we might go to the heart of divides,"},{"time":27000,"text":"to places of conflict,"},{"time":28292,"text":"like journalists always have,"},{"time":29833,"text":"but then, once there,
do something really different."},{"time":34375,"text":"We knew we wanted to take
the core tools of our craft --"},{"time":37292,"text":"careful vetting of information,
diligent research, curiosity,"},{"time":41000,"text":"a commitment to serving the public good --"},{"time":43417,"text":"to serving our democracy --"},{"time":44875,"text":"and do something new."},{"time":46917,"text":"And so we mapped out this process,"},{"time":48875,"text":"what we call dialogue journalism,"},{"time":50667,"text":"for going to the heart
of social and political divides,"},{"time":53833,"text":"and then, once there, building
journalism-supported conversations"},{"time":57250,"text":"between people on opposite sides
of polarizing issues."}]},{"cues":[{"time":63500,"text":"But how actually to do this
in a world that's so divided,"},{"time":67333,"text":"so deeply divided --"},{"time":68792,"text":"when we live in a world"},{"time":70083,"text":"in which cousins and aunts and uncles
can't talk to one another,"},{"time":73792,"text":"when we often live in separate
and distinct news ecosystems,"},{"time":77917,"text":"and when we reflexively
and habitually malign and dismiss"},{"time":81500,"text":"those with whom we disagree?"},{"time":84542,"text":"But we wanted to try."},{"time":86083,"text":"And so right after the 2016 election,"},{"time":88750,"text":"in that time between the election
and the inauguration,"},{"time":92458,"text":"we partnered with the Alabama Media Group
to do something really different."},{"time":96625,"text":"We brought 25 Trump supporters
from Alabama together"},{"time":99875,"text":"in conversation with
25 Clinton supporters from California."},{"time":103667,"text":"And we brought them together
in a closed, moderated Facebook group"},{"time":107958,"text":"that we kept open for a month."},{"time":111625,"text":"What we wanted to do"},{"time":112958,"text":"was to give them a place to engage
with genuine curiosity and openness."},{"time":116917,"text":"And we wanted to support them
in building relationships,"},{"time":119583,"text":"not just with each other
but with us as journalists."},{"time":122917,"text":"And then we wanted to supply
facts and information --"},{"time":125708,"text":"facts and information that they could
actually receive and process"},{"time":129083,"text":"and use to undergird their conversations."}]},{"cues":[{"time":133292,"text":"And so as a prelude to this conversation,"},{"time":135792,"text":"the first step in what we call
dialogue journalism,"},{"time":138667,"text":"we asked what they thought
the other side thought of them."},{"time":143250,"text":"So when we asked
the Trump supporters from Alabama"},{"time":147167,"text":"what they thought the Clinton supporters
in California thought of them,"},{"time":150583,"text":"this is some of what they said."},{"time":152500,"text":""They think we are religious
Bible thumpers.""},{"time":154667,"text":""That we're backwards
and hickish, and stupid.""},{"time":158250,"text":""They think that we all have
Confederate flags in our yards,"},{"time":161125,"text":"that we're racist
and sexist and uneducated.""},{"time":163292,"text":""They think we're barefoot and pregnant,
with dirt driveways.""},{"time":167458,"text":""And they think we're all prissy butts"},{"time":169333,"text":"and that we walk around in hoop skirts
with cotton fields in the background.""}]},{"cues":[{"time":173167,"text":"And then we asked that same question
of the Californians:"},{"time":175917,"text":""What do you think
the Alabamians think about you?""},{"time":178792,"text":"And they said this:
"That we're crazy, liberal Californians.""},{"time":182167,"text":""That we're not patriotic.""},{"time":183667,"text":""We're snobby and we're elitist.""},{"time":185263,"text":""We're godless and we're permissive
with our children.""},{"time":188542,"text":""And that we're focused
on our careers, not our family.""},{"time":191208,"text":""That we're elitist,
pie-in-the-sky intellectuals,"},{"time":193833,"text":"rich people, Whole Foods-eating,"},{"time":196417,"text":"very out of touch.""}]},{"cues":[{"time":199667,"text":"So by asking questions like this
at the start of every conversation"},{"time":203292,"text":"and by identifying
and sharing stereotypes,"},{"time":206542,"text":"we find that people --
people on all sides --"},{"time":208792,"text":"begin to see the simplistic and often
mean-spirited caricatures they carry."},{"time":214042,"text":"And in that --"},{"time":215333,"text":"after that, we can move
into a process of genuine conversation."}]},{"cues":[{"time":220875,"text":"So in the two years since that launch --
California/Alabama Project --"},{"time":224208,"text":"we've gone on to host
dialogues and partnerships"},{"time":226500,"text":"with media organizations
across the country."},{"time":229042,"text":"And they've been about
some of our most contentious issues:"},{"time":231875,"text":"guns, immigration, race, education."},{"time":235917,"text":"And what we found,"},{"time":237542,"text":"remarkably,"},{"time":238833,"text":"is that real dialogue is in fact possible."},{"time":241458,"text":"And that when given a chance
and structure around doing so,"},{"time":244750,"text":"many, not all,
but many of our fellow citizens"},{"time":247208,"text":"are eager to engage with the other."}]},{"cues":[{"time":252625,"text":"Too often journalists
have sharpened divides"},{"time":255125,"text":"in the name of drama or readership
or in service to our own views."},{"time":259666,"text":"And too often we've gone to each side
quoting a partisan voice on one side"},{"time":263208,"text":"and a partisan voice on the other"},{"time":265083,"text":"with a telling anecdotal lead
and a pithy final quote,"},{"time":268042,"text":"all of which readers
are keen to mine for bias."},{"time":271667,"text":"But our dialogue-based process
has a slower pace and a different center."},{"time":277375,"text":"And our work is guided by the principle"},{"time":280125,"text":"that dialogue across difference
is essential to a functioning democracy,"},{"time":283917,"text":"and that journalism and journalists
have a multifaceted role to play"},{"time":288042,"text":"in supporting that."}]},{"cues":[{"time":291125,"text":"So how do we work?"},{"time":293583,"text":"At every stage,
we're as transparent as possible"},{"time":296708,"text":"about our methods and our motives."},{"time":298833,"text":"At every stage, we take time
to answer people's questions --"},{"time":301708,"text":"explain why we're doing what we're doing."},{"time":304375,"text":"We tell people that it's not a trap:"},{"time":306750,"text":"no one's there to tell you you're stupid,"},{"time":308750,"text":"no one's there to tell you
your experience doesn't matter."},{"time":312167,"text":"And we always ask
for a really different sort of behavior,"},{"time":315250,"text":"a repatterning away
from the reflexive name-calling,"},{"time":318458,"text":"so entrenched in our discourse"},{"time":319958,"text":"that most of us, on all sides,
don't even notice it anymore."}]},{"cues":[{"time":325917,"text":"So people often come
into our conversations a bit angrily."},{"time":329000,"text":"They say things like,
"How can you believe X?""},{"time":331500,"text":"and "How can you read Y?""},{"time":333417,"text":"and "Can you believe that this happened?""},{"time":337083,"text":"But generally, in this miracle
that delights us every time,"},{"time":340708,"text":"people begin to introduce themselves."},{"time":342500,"text":"And they begin to explain
who they are and where they come from,"},{"time":345583,"text":"and they begin to ask
questions of one another."},{"time":348125,"text":"And slowly, over time, people circle back
again and again to difficult topics,"},{"time":352208,"text":"each time with a little more empathy,
a little more nuance,"},{"time":355250,"text":"a little more curiosity."},{"time":357958,"text":"And our journalists and moderators
work really hard to support this"},{"time":361167,"text":"because it's not a debate,
it's not a battle,"},{"time":363917,"text":"it's not a Sunday morning talk show."},{"time":366083,"text":"It's not the flinging of talking points."},{"time":368917,"text":"It's not the stacking of memes and gifs"},{"time":370833,"text":"or articles with headlines
that prove a point."},{"time":373625,"text":"And it's not about scoring
political victories with question traps."}]},{"cues":[{"time":379542,"text":"So what we've learned is that our state
of discord is bad for everyone."},{"time":384750,"text":"It is a deeply unhappy state of being."},{"time":387750,"text":"And people tell us this again and again."},{"time":390042,"text":"They say they appreciate the chance
to engage respectfully,"},{"time":393500,"text":"with curiosity and with openness,"},{"time":395125,"text":"and that they're glad and relieved
for a chance to put down their arms."},{"time":400208,"text":"And so we do our work in direct challenge"},{"time":402792,"text":"to the political climate
in our country right now,"},{"time":405750,"text":"and we do it knowing
that it is difficult, challenging work"},{"time":408583,"text":"to hold and support people
in opposing backgrounds in conversation."},{"time":413333,"text":"And we do it knowing
democracy depends on our ability"},{"time":416875,"text":"to address our shared problems together."},{"time":419917,"text":"And we do this work by putting community
at the heart of our journalistic process,"},{"time":423833,"text":"by putting our egos to the side
to listen first, to listen deeply,"},{"time":427458,"text":"to listen around
and through our own biases,"},{"time":430417,"text":"our own habits of thought,"},{"time":431917,"text":"and to support others in doing the same."},{"time":435708,"text":"And we do this work"},{"time":437042,"text":"knowing that journalism
as an institution is struggling,"},{"time":439708,"text":"and that it has always had a role to play
and will continue to have a role to play"},{"time":443625,"text":"in supporting the exchange
of ideas and views."}]},{"cues":[{"time":448458,"text":"For many of the participants
in our groups,"},{"time":450542,"text":"there are lasting reverberations."},{"time":452667,"text":"Many people have become Facebook friends
and in-real-life friends too,"},{"time":456000,"text":"across political lines."},{"time":457500,"text":"After we closed that first
Trump/Clinton project,"},{"time":461083,"text":"about two-thirds of the women went on
to form their own Facebook group"},{"time":464417,"text":"and they chose a moderator from each state"},{"time":466441,"text":"and they continue to talk
about difficult and challenging issues."},{"time":470208,"text":"People tell us again and again
that they're grateful for the opportunity"},{"time":473667,"text":"to be a part of this work,"},{"time":475000,"text":"grateful to know that people
on the other side aren't crazy,"},{"time":478292,"text":"grateful that they've had a chance
to connect with people"},{"time":481000,"text":"they wouldn't have otherwise talked to."}]},{"cues":[{"time":484708,"text":"A lot of what we've seen and learned,"},{"time":486542,"text":"despite the fact that we call
ourselves Spaceship Media,"},{"time":489208,"text":"is not at all rocket science."},{"time":490667,"text":"If you call people names,
if you label them, if you insult them,"},{"time":493875,"text":"they are not inclined to listen to you."},{"time":496458,"text":"Snark doesn't help, shame doesn't help,"},{"time":498667,"text":"condescension doesn't help."},{"time":501958,"text":"Genuine communication
takes practice and effort"},{"time":505208,"text":"and restraint and self-awareness."},{"time":508250,"text":"There isn't an algorithm
to solve where we are."},{"time":512417,"text":"Because real human connection
is in fact real human connection."},{"time":517082,"text":"So lead with curiosity,"},{"time":519125,"text":"emphasize discussion not debate,"},{"time":520832,"text":"get out of your silo,"},{"time":524125,"text":"because real connection
across difference ..."},{"time":527917,"text":"this is a salve
that our democracy sorely needs."}]},{"cues":[{"time":532083,"text":"Thank you."}]},{"cues":[{"time":533375,"text":"(Applause)"}]}]}

speaker: Rosalind Picard
title: An AI smartwatch that detects seizures
text:
{"paragraphs":[{"cues":[{"time":1747,"text":"This is Henry,"},{"time":3258,"text":"a cute boy,"},{"time":5088,"text":"and when Henry was three,"},{"time":7250,"text":"his mom found him having
some febrile seizures."},{"time":13080,"text":"Febrile seizures are seizures that occur
when you also have a fever,"},{"time":18064,"text":"and the doctor said,"},{"time":19986,"text":""Don't worry too much.
Kids usually outgrow these.""},{"time":23506,"text":"When he was four,
he had a convulsive seizure,"},{"time":27511,"text":"the kind that you lose
consciousness and shake --"},{"time":30797,"text":"a generalized tonic-clonic seizure --"},{"time":33717,"text":"and while the diagnosis of epilepsy
was in the mail,"},{"time":41763,"text":"Henry's mom went to get him
out of bed one morning,"},{"time":45324,"text":"and as she went in his room,"},{"time":48753,"text":"she found his cold, lifeless body."}]},{"cues":[{"time":55904,"text":"Henry died of SUDEP,"},{"time":57984,"text":"sudden unexpected death in epilepsy."},{"time":61714,"text":"I'm curious how many of you
have heard of SUDEP."},{"time":65603,"text":"This is a very well-educated audience,
and I see only a few hands."},{"time":69993,"text":"SUDEP is when an otherwise
healthy person with epilepsy"},{"time":73983,"text":"dies and they can't attribute it
to anything they can find in an autopsy."},{"time":80082,"text":"There is a SUDEP
every seven to nine minutes."},{"time":84217,"text":"That's on average two per TED Talk."},{"time":91411,"text":"Now, a normal brain
has electrical activity."},{"time":95094,"text":"You can see some of the electrical waves"},{"time":97253,"text":"coming out of this picture
of a brain here."},{"time":100341,"text":"And these should look
like typical electrical activity"},{"time":104111,"text":"that an EEG could read on the surface."},{"time":106270,"text":"When you have a seizure,
it's a bit of unusual electrical activity,"},{"time":110711,"text":"and it can be focal."},{"time":112120,"text":"It can take place
in just a small part of your brain."},{"time":114644,"text":"When that happens,
you might have a strange sensation."},{"time":118476,"text":"Several could be happening
here in the audience right now,"},{"time":121533,"text":"and the person next to you
might not even know."},{"time":124159,"text":"However, if you have a seizure
where that little brush fire spreads"},{"time":128103,"text":"like a forest fire over the brain,"},{"time":130119,"text":"then it generalizes,"},{"time":131817,"text":"and that generalized seizure
takes your consciousness away"},{"time":136412,"text":"and causes you to convulse."}]},{"cues":[{"time":138680,"text":"There are more SUDEPs
in the United States every year"},{"time":142846,"text":"than sudden infant death syndrome."},{"time":146298,"text":"Now, how many of you have heard
of sudden infant death syndrome?"},{"time":149324,"text":"Right? Pretty much every hand goes up."},{"time":151304,"text":"So what's going on here?"},{"time":153051,"text":"Why is this so much more common
and yet people haven't heard of it?"},{"time":158218,"text":"And what can you do to prevent it?"},{"time":160678,"text":"Well, there are two things,
scientifically shown,"},{"time":163004,"text":"that prevent or reduce the risk of SUDEP."},{"time":167115,"text":"The first is: "Follow
your doctor's instructions,"},{"time":169694,"text":"take your medications.""},{"time":171154,"text":"Two-thirds of people who have epilepsy"},{"time":173379,"text":"get it under control
with their medications."},{"time":175848,"text":"The second thing that reduces
the risk of SUDEP is companionship."},{"time":180043,"text":"It's having somebody there
at the time that you have a seizure."},{"time":184761,"text":"Now, SUDEP, even though
most of you have never heard of it,"},{"time":188706,"text":"is actually the number two cause
of years of potential life lost"},{"time":193919,"text":"of all neurological disorders."},{"time":197197,"text":"The vertical axis is the number of deaths"},{"time":201507,"text":"times the remaining life span,"},{"time":204697,"text":"so higher is much worse impact."},{"time":208522,"text":"SUDEP, however, unlike these others,"},{"time":211520,"text":"is something that people right here
could do something to push that down."}]},{"cues":[{"time":217778,"text":"Now, what is Roz Picard, an AI researcher,
doing here telling you about SUDEP, right?"},{"time":224802,"text":"I'm not a neurologist."},{"time":227347,"text":"When I was working at the Media Lab
on measurement of emotion,"},{"time":231586,"text":"trying to make our machines
more intelligent about our emotions,"},{"time":234832,"text":"we started doing a lot of work
measuring stress."},{"time":239212,"text":"We built lots of sensors"},{"time":241172,"text":"that measured it
in lots of different ways."},{"time":243577,"text":"But one of them in particular"},{"time":245921,"text":"grew out of some of this very old work
with measuring sweaty palms"},{"time":250057,"text":"with an electrical signal."},{"time":251825,"text":"This is a signal of skin conductance"},{"time":253598,"text":"that's known to go up
when you get nervous,"},{"time":255740,"text":"but it turns out it also goes up with
a lot of other interesting conditions."},{"time":259336,"text":"But measuring it with wires on your hand
is really inconvenient."},{"time":262382,"text":"So we invented a bunch of other ways
of doing this at the MIT Media Lab."},{"time":266151,"text":"And with these wearables,"},{"time":268348,"text":"we started to collect the first-ever
clinical quality data 24-7."},{"time":273609,"text":"Here's a picture of what that looked like"},{"time":276166,"text":"the first time an MIT student collected
skin conductance on the wrist 24-7."},{"time":283187,"text":"Let's zoom in a little bit here."},{"time":285569,"text":"What you see is 24 hours
from left to right,"},{"time":288618,"text":"and here is two days of data."},{"time":290569,"text":"And first, what surprised us"},{"time":293275,"text":"was sleep was the biggest
peak of the day."},{"time":296645,"text":"Now, that sounds broken, right?"},{"time":298419,"text":"You're calm when you're asleep,
so what's going on here?"}]},{"cues":[{"time":302621,"text":"Well, it turns out
that our physiology during sleep"},{"time":305098,"text":"is very different
than our physiology during wake,"},{"time":307765,"text":"and while there's still a bit of a mystery"},{"time":309973,"text":"why these peaks are usually
the biggest of the day during sleep,"},{"time":313741,"text":"we now believe they're related
to memory consolidation"},{"time":316935,"text":"and memory formation during sleep."}]},{"cues":[{"time":319895,"text":"We also saw things
that were exactly what we expected."},{"time":323490,"text":"When an MIT student
is working hard in the lab"},{"time":325864,"text":"or on homeworks,"},{"time":327277,"text":"there is not only emotional stress,
but there's cognitive load,"},{"time":331848,"text":"and it turns out that cognitive load,
cognitive effort, mental engagement,"},{"time":336733,"text":"excitement about learning something --"},{"time":338951,"text":"those things also make the signal go up."}]},{"cues":[{"time":343014,"text":"Unfortunately, to the embarrassment
of we MIT professors,"}]},{"cues":[{"time":346776,"text":"(Laughter)"}]},{"cues":[{"time":347879,"text":"the low point every day
is classroom activity."},{"time":352810,"text":"Now, I am just showing you
one person's data here,"},{"time":355350,"text":"but this, unfortunately,
is true in general."}]},{"cues":[{"time":360400,"text":"This sweatband has inside it
a homebuilt skin-conductance sensor,"},{"time":364813,"text":"and one day, one of our undergrads
knocked on my door"},{"time":369923,"text":"right at the end of the December semester,"},{"time":372622,"text":"and he said, "Professor Picard,"},{"time":374836,"text":"can I please borrow
one of your wristband sensors?"},{"time":377574,"text":"My little brother has autism,
he can't talk,"},{"time":381327,"text":"and I want to see
what's stressing him out.""},{"time":384434,"text":"And I said, "Sure, in fact,
don't just take one, take two,""},{"time":387316,"text":"because they broke easily back then."},{"time":390132,"text":"So he took them home,
he put them on his little brother."},{"time":392776,"text":"Now, I was back in MIT,
looking at the data on my laptop,"},{"time":395969,"text":"and the first day, I thought,
"Hmm, that's odd,"},{"time":398854,"text":"he put them on both wrists
instead of waiting for one to break."},{"time":401869,"text":"OK, fine, don't follow my instructions.""},{"time":404213,"text":"I'm glad he didn't."},{"time":406377,"text":"Second day -- chill.
Looked like classroom activity."}]},{"cues":[{"time":409607,"text":"(Laughter)"}]},{"cues":[{"time":411389,"text":"A few more days ahead."},{"time":413404,"text":"The next day, one wrist signal was flat"},{"time":417942,"text":"and the other had
the biggest peak I've ever seen,"},{"time":422496,"text":"and I thought, "What's going on?"},{"time":424838,"text":"We've stressed people out at MIT
every way imaginable."},{"time":428933,"text":"I've never seen a peak this big.""},{"time":432409,"text":"And it was only on one side."},{"time":434402,"text":"How can you be stressed on one side
of your body and not the other?"},{"time":437570,"text":"So I thought one or both sensors
must be broken."},{"time":441185,"text":"Now, I'm an electroengineer by training,"},{"time":443126,"text":"so I started a whole bunch of stuff
to try to debug this,"},{"time":445819,"text":"and long story short,
I could not reproduce this."}]},{"cues":[{"time":448962,"text":"So I resorted to old-fashioned debugging."},{"time":452019,"text":"I called the student at home on vacation."},{"time":455325,"text":""Hi, how's your little brother?
How's your Christmas?"},{"time":459692,"text":"Hey, do you have any idea
what happened to him?""},{"time":462997,"text":"And I gave this particular date and time,"},{"time":464977,"text":"and the data."},{"time":466302,"text":"And he said, "I don't know,
I'll check the diary.""}]},{"cues":[{"time":470850,"text":"Diary? An MIT student keeps a diary?"},{"time":473782,"text":"So I waited and he came back."},{"time":475625,"text":"He had the exact date and time,"},{"time":477188,"text":"and he says, "That was right before
he had a grand mal seizure.""}]},{"cues":[{"time":482942,"text":"Now, at the time, I didn't know
anything about epilepsy,"},{"time":486315,"text":"and did a bunch of research,"},{"time":488498,"text":"realized that another student's dad
is chief of neurosurgery"},{"time":491648,"text":"at Children's Hospital Boston,"},{"time":493672,"text":"screwed up my courage
and called Dr. Joe Madsen."}]},{"cues":[{"time":495985,"text":""Hi, Dr. Madsen,
my name's Rosalind Picard."},{"time":498478,"text":"Is it possible somebody could have"},{"time":502398,"text":"a huge sympathetic
nervous system surge" --"},{"time":506825,"text":"that's what drives the skin conductance --"},{"time":509427,"text":""20 minutes before a seizure?""},{"time":512172,"text":"And he says, "Probably not.""},{"time":515997,"text":"He says, "It's interesting."},{"time":517355,"text":"We've had people whose hair
stands on end on one arm"},{"time":520147,"text":"20 minutes before a seizure.""},{"time":523060,"text":"And I'm like, "On one arm?""},{"time":524399,"text":"I didn't want to tell him that, initially,"},{"time":526553,"text":"because I thought this was too ridiculous."}]},{"cues":[{"time":528966,"text":"He explained how this could
happen in the brain,"},{"time":531283,"text":"and he got interested.
I showed him the data."},{"time":533480,"text":"We made a whole bunch more devices,
got them safety certified."},{"time":536452,"text":"90 families were being
enrolled in a study,"},{"time":538550,"text":"all with children who were going
to be monitored 24-7"},{"time":541803,"text":"with gold-standard EEG on their scalp"},{"time":545198,"text":"for reading the brain activity,"},{"time":546765,"text":"video to watch the behavior,"},{"time":548732,"text":"electrocardiogram -- ECG --
and now EDA, electrodermal activity,"},{"time":552416,"text":"to see if there was
something in this periphery"},{"time":555025,"text":"that we could easily pick up,
related to a seizure."}]},{"cues":[{"time":558263,"text":"We found, in 100 percent
of the first batch of grand mal seizures,"},{"time":564728,"text":"this whopper of responses
in the skin conductance."},{"time":568385,"text":"The blue in the middle, the boy's sleep,"},{"time":570412,"text":"is usually the biggest peak of the day."},{"time":572408,"text":"These three seizures you see here
are popping out of the forest"},{"time":576064,"text":"like redwood trees."},{"time":579096,"text":"Furthermore, when you couple
the skin conductance at the top"},{"time":582700,"text":"with the movement from the wrist"},{"time":586241,"text":"and you get lots of data
and train machine learning and AI on it,"},{"time":591065,"text":"you can build an automated AI
that detects these patterns"},{"time":595882,"text":"much better than just
a shake detector can do."},{"time":600121,"text":"So we realized that we needed
to get this out,"},{"time":604412,"text":"and with the PhD work of Ming-Zher Poh"},{"time":606794,"text":"and later great improvements by Empatica,"},{"time":609845,"text":"this has made progress and the seizure
detection is much more accurate."}]},{"cues":[{"time":613713,"text":"But we also learned some other things
about SUDEP during this."},{"time":616642,"text":"One thing we learned is that SUDEP,"},{"time":620078,"text":"while it's rare after
a generalized tonic-clonic seizure,"},{"time":623014,"text":"that's when it's most likely
to happen -- after that type."},{"time":626275,"text":"And when it happens,
it doesn't happen during the seizure,"},{"time":629418,"text":"and it doesn't usually happen
immediately afterwards,"},{"time":632308,"text":"but immediately afterwards,"},{"time":634047,"text":"when the person just seems
very still and quiet,"},{"time":637133,"text":"they may go into another phase,
where the breathing stops,"},{"time":642104,"text":"and then after the breathing stops,
later the heart stops."},{"time":645152,"text":"So there's some time
to get somebody there."},{"time":648349,"text":"We also learned that there is a region
deep in the brain called the amygdala,"},{"time":653277,"text":"which we had been studying
in our emotion research a lot."},{"time":656237,"text":"We have two amygdalas,"},{"time":657542,"text":"and if you stimulate the right one,"},{"time":659239,"text":"you get a big right
skin conductance response."},{"time":662002,"text":"Now, you have to sign up right now
for a craniotomy to get this done,"},{"time":666271,"text":"not exactly something
we're going to volunteer to do,"},{"time":669128,"text":"but it causes a big right skin
conductance response."},{"time":671665,"text":"Stimulate the left one, big left
skin conductance response on the palm."},{"time":675542,"text":"And furthermore, when somebody
stimulates your amygdala"},{"time":679606,"text":"while you're sitting there
and you might just be working,"},{"time":683049,"text":"you don't show any signs of distress,"},{"time":685620,"text":"but you stop breathing,"},{"time":688470,"text":"and you don't start again
until somebody stimulates you."},{"time":692599,"text":""Hey, Roz, are you there?""},{"time":694136,"text":"And you open your mouth to talk."},{"time":696868,"text":"As you take that breath to speak,"},{"time":699086,"text":"you start breathing again."}]},{"cues":[{"time":702762,"text":"So we had started with work on stress,"},{"time":706406,"text":"which had enabled us
to build lots of sensors"},{"time":708683,"text":"that were gathering
high quality enough data"},{"time":710839,"text":"that we could leave the lab
and start to get this in the wild;"},{"time":713784,"text":"accidentally found a whopper
of a response with the seizure,"},{"time":716672,"text":"neurological activation that can cause
a much bigger response"},{"time":719555,"text":"than traditional stressors;"},{"time":720889,"text":"lots of partnership with hospitals
and an epilepsy monitoring unit,"},{"time":724111,"text":"especially Children's Hospital Boston"},{"time":725963,"text":"and the Brigham;"},{"time":727138,"text":"and machine learning and AI on top of this"},{"time":729687,"text":"to take and collect lots more data"},{"time":732732,"text":"in service of trying
to understand these events"},{"time":735385,"text":"and if we could prevent SUDEP."}]},{"cues":[{"time":738023,"text":"This is now commercialized by Empatica,"},{"time":741610,"text":"a start-up that I had
the privilege to cofound,"},{"time":744523,"text":"and the team there has done an amazing job
improving the technology"},{"time":748753,"text":"to make a very beautiful sensor"},{"time":750536,"text":"that not only tells time and does steps
and sleep and all that good stuff,"},{"time":754419,"text":"but this is running real-time
AI and machine learning"},{"time":757539,"text":"to detect generalized
tonic-clonic seizures"},{"time":760181,"text":"and send an alert for help"},{"time":762356,"text":"if I were to have a seizure
and lose consciousness."},{"time":765572,"text":"This just got FDA-approved"},{"time":768412,"text":"as the first smartwatch
to get approved in neurology."}]},{"cues":[{"time":773923,"text":"(Applause)"}]},{"cues":[{"time":782674,"text":"Now, the next slide is what made
my skin conductance go up."},{"time":786811,"text":"One morning, I'm checking my email"},{"time":788541,"text":"and I see a story from a mom"},{"time":790862,"text":"who said she was in the shower,"},{"time":792772,"text":"and her phone was
on the counter by the shower,"},{"time":795249,"text":"and it said her daughter
might need her help."},{"time":798196,"text":"So she interrupts her shower and goes
running to her daughter's bedroom,"},{"time":801601,"text":"and she finds her daughter
facedown in bed, blue and not breathing."},{"time":805368,"text":"She flips her over -- human stimulation --"},{"time":808673,"text":"and her daughter takes a breath,
and another breath,"},{"time":812380,"text":"and her daughter turns pink and is fine."}]},{"cues":[{"time":817551,"text":"I think I turned white reading this email."},{"time":820799,"text":"My first response is,
"Oh no, it's not perfect."},{"time":823145,"text":"The Bluetooth could break,
the battery could die."},{"time":825494,"text":"All these things could go wrong.
Don't rely on this.""},{"time":827995,"text":"And she said, "It's OK.
I know no technology is perfect."},{"time":831427,"text":"None of us can always
be there all the time."},{"time":834844,"text":"But this, this device plus AI"},{"time":839210,"text":"enabled me to get there in time
to save my daughter's life.""}]},{"cues":[{"time":845933,"text":"Now, I've been mentioning children,"},{"time":847863,"text":"but SUDEP peaks, actually,
among people in their 20s, 30s and 40s,"},{"time":853594,"text":"and the next line I'm going to put up"},{"time":855434,"text":"is probably going to make
some people uncomfortable,"},{"time":857911,"text":"but it's less uncomfortable
than we'll all be"},{"time":860309,"text":"if this list is extended
to somebody you know."},{"time":864437,"text":"Could this happen to somebody you know?"},{"time":867197,"text":"And the reason I bring up
this uncomfortable question"},{"time":869963,"text":"is because one in 26 of you
will have epilepsy at some point,"},{"time":874899,"text":"and from what I've been learning,"},{"time":877158,"text":"people with epilepsy often don't tell
their friends and their neighbors"},{"time":880516,"text":"that they have it."},{"time":881698,"text":"So if you're willing to let them
use an AI or whatever"},{"time":886643,"text":"to summon you in a moment
of possible need,"},{"time":891081,"text":"if you would let them know that,"},{"time":892723,"text":"you could make a difference in their life."}]},{"cues":[{"time":895728,"text":"Why do all this hard work to build AIs?"},{"time":900101,"text":"A couple of reasons here:"},{"time":901326,"text":"one is Natasha, the girl who lived,"},{"time":903513,"text":"and her family wanted me
to tell you her name."},{"time":906977,"text":"Another is her family"},{"time":908613,"text":"and the wonderful people out there"},{"time":910828,"text":"who want to be there to support people
who have conditions"},{"time":913677,"text":"that they've felt uncomfortable
in the past mentioning to others."},{"time":917901,"text":"And the other reason is all of you,"},{"time":919798,"text":"because we have the opportunity
to shape the future of AI."},{"time":925154,"text":"We can actually change it,"},{"time":927535,"text":"because we are the ones building it."}]},{"cues":[{"time":929963,"text":"So let's build AI"},{"time":931964,"text":"that makes everybody's lives better."}]},{"cues":[{"time":935982,"text":"Thank you."}]},{"cues":[{"time":937157,"text":"(Applause)"}]}]}

speaker: Keith Kirkland
title: Wearable tech that helps you navigate by touch
text:
{"paragraphs":[{"cues":[{"time":706,"text":"Do you remember your first kiss?"},{"time":3548,"text":"Or that time you burned
the roof of your mouth"},{"time":5785,"text":"on a hot slice of pizza?"},{"time":7532,"text":"What about playing tag
or duck, duck, goose as a child?"},{"time":10863,"text":"These are all instances where
we're using touch to understand something."},{"time":14974,"text":"And it's the basis of haptic design."}]},{"cues":[{"time":17434,"text":""Haptic" means of or relating to
the sense of touch."},{"time":20252,"text":"And we've all been using that
our entire lives."},{"time":23791,"text":"I was working on my computer
when my friend,"},{"time":26308,"text":"seeing me hunched over typing,
walked over behind me."},{"time":29617,"text":"She put her left thumb
into the left side of my lower back,"},{"time":32537,"text":"while reaching her right index finger
around to the front of my right shoulder."},{"time":36315,"text":"Instinctively, I sat up straight."},{"time":38179,"text":"In one quick and gentle gesture,"},{"time":40395,"text":"she had communicated
how to improve my posture."},{"time":43561,"text":"The paper I was working on
at that very moment"},{"time":45754,"text":"centered around developing new ways
to teach movement using technology."},{"time":49579,"text":"I wanted to create a suit
that could teach a person kung fu."}]},{"cues":[{"time":53434,"text":"(Laughter)"}]},{"cues":[{"time":55260,"text":"But I had no idea how
to communicate movement"},{"time":57403,"text":"without an instructor being in the room."},{"time":60187,"text":"And in that moment,
it became crystal clear: touch."},{"time":64657,"text":"If I had vibrating motors
where she had placed each of her fingers,"},{"time":68180,"text":"paired with motion-capture data
of my current and optimal posture,"},{"time":72570,"text":"I could simulate the entire experience"},{"time":74497,"text":"without an instructor
needing to be in the room."},{"time":76995,"text":"But there was still one important part
of the puzzle that was missing."},{"time":80727,"text":"If I want you to raise your wrist
two inches off of your lap,"},{"time":83624,"text":"using vibration,"},{"time":85361,"text":"how do I tell you to do that?"},{"time":88237,"text":"Do I put a motor at the top of your wrist,
so you know to lift up?"},{"time":91539,"text":"Or do I put one
at the bottom of your wrist,"},{"time":93658,"text":"so it feels like you're being pushed up?"},{"time":95610,"text":"There were no readily available answers"},{"time":97546,"text":"because there was no commonly
agreed-upon haptic language"},{"time":100245,"text":"to communicate information with."}]},{"cues":[{"time":102188,"text":"So my cofounders and I
set out to create that language."},{"time":105987,"text":"And the first device we built
was not a kung fu suit."}]},{"cues":[{"time":109178,"text":"(Laughter)"}]},{"cues":[{"time":110408,"text":"But in a way, it was even more impressive"},{"time":112792,"text":"because of its simplicity and usefulness."},{"time":115394,"text":"We started with the use case
of navigation,"},{"time":117823,"text":"which is a simplified form of movement."},{"time":120687,"text":"We then created Wayband,"},{"time":123561,"text":"a wrist-wearable device that could
orient a user toward a destination,"},{"time":127414,"text":"using vibrating cues."},{"time":130235,"text":"We would ask people to spin around"},{"time":133054,"text":"and to stop in a way that they felt
was the right way to go."},{"time":137061,"text":"Informally, we tried this
with hundreds of people,"},{"time":139458,"text":"and most could figure it out
within about 15 seconds."},{"time":142441,"text":"It was that intuitive."}]},{"cues":[{"time":144847,"text":"Initially, we were just trying to get
people out of their phones"},{"time":147953,"text":"and back into the real world."},{"time":149776,"text":"But the more we experimented,"},{"time":151760,"text":"the more we realized that those
who stood to benefit most from our work"},{"time":155951,"text":"were people who had little or no sight."},{"time":159387,"text":"When we first approached
a blind organization, they told us,"},{"time":162276,"text":""Don't build a blind device."},{"time":164680,"text":"Build a device that everyone can use"},{"time":166704,"text":"but that's optimized
for the blind experience.""},{"time":169505,"text":"We created our company WearWorks
with three guiding principles:"},{"time":174792,"text":"make cool stuff,"},{"time":176490,"text":"create the greatest impact we can
in our lifetimes"},{"time":179442,"text":"and reimagine an entire world
designed for touch."}]},{"cues":[{"time":183620,"text":"And on November 5, 2017,"},{"time":187446,"text":"Wayband helped a person who was blind"},{"time":190382,"text":"run the first 15 miles
of the New York City Marathon"},{"time":193188,"text":"without any sighted assistance."}]},{"cues":[{"time":195165,"text":"(Applause)"}]},{"cues":[{"time":203744,"text":"It didn't get him through the entire race
due to the heavy rain,"},{"time":206785,"text":"but that didn't matter."}]},{"cues":[{"time":207999,"text":"(Laughter)"}]},{"cues":[{"time":209030,"text":"We had proved the point:"},{"time":210268,"text":"that it was possible to navigate
a complex route using only touch."}]},{"cues":[{"time":213847,"text":"So, why touch?"},{"time":215903,"text":"The skin has an innate sensitivity"},{"time":217618,"text":"akin to the eyes' ability
to recognize millions of colors"},{"time":221109,"text":"or the ears' ability to recognize
complex pitch and tone."},{"time":224387,"text":"Yet, as a communications channel,"},{"time":226038,"text":"it's been largely relegated to
Morse code-like cell phone notifications."},{"time":229696,"text":"If you were to suddenly receive
a kiss or a punch,"},{"time":232792,"text":"your reaction would be
instinctive and immediate."},{"time":236378,"text":"Meanwhile, your brain would be playing
catch-up on the back end"},{"time":239397,"text":"to understand the details
of what just occurred."},{"time":241714,"text":"And compared to instincts,
conscious thought is pretty slow."},{"time":245706,"text":"But it's a lightning bolt"},{"time":246993,"text":"compared to the snail's pace
of language acquisition."},{"time":250008,"text":"I spent a considerable amount of time"},{"time":252395,"text":"learning Spanish, Japanese,
German and currently Swedish,"},{"time":258125,"text":"with varying degrees of failure."}]},{"cues":[{"time":259856,"text":"(Laughter)"}]},{"cues":[{"time":263482,"text":"But within those failures were kernels
of how different languages are organized."},{"time":267659,"text":"That gave our team insight"},{"time":269390,"text":"into how to use the linguistic order
of well-established languages"},{"time":273152,"text":"as inspiration for
an entirely new haptic language,"},{"time":276538,"text":"one based purely on touch."},{"time":278950,"text":"It also showed us when using language
mechanics wasn't the best way"},{"time":282543,"text":"to deliver information."},{"time":284823,"text":"In the same way a smile is a smile
across every culture,"},{"time":288339,"text":"what if there was some
underlying mechanism of touch"},{"time":290800,"text":"that transcended linguistic
and cultural boundaries?"},{"time":294235,"text":"A universal language, of sorts."}]},{"cues":[{"time":296646,"text":"You see, I could give you
buzz-buzz-buzz, buzz-buzz,"},{"time":301092,"text":"and you would eventually learn"},{"time":302567,"text":"that that particular
vibration means "stop.""},{"time":305123,"text":"But as haptic designers,
we challenged ourselves."},{"time":309045,"text":"What would it be like to design "stop?""},{"time":312299,"text":"Well, based on context,"},{"time":313562,"text":"most of us have the experience
of being in a vehicle"},{"time":316030,"text":"and having that vehicle stop suddenly,
along with our body's reaction to it."},{"time":320545,"text":"So if I wanted you to stop,"},{"time":322298,"text":"I could send you
a vibration pattern, sure."},{"time":324339,"text":"Or, I could design a haptic experience"},{"time":327123,"text":"that just made stopping
feel like it was the right thing to do."},{"time":331496,"text":"And that takes more than an arbitrary
assignment of haptic cues to meanings."},{"time":335704,"text":"It takes a deep empathy."},{"time":337950,"text":"It also takes the ability to distill
human experience into meaningful insights"},{"time":342744,"text":"and then into haptic
gestures and products."}]},{"cues":[{"time":347133,"text":"Haptic design is going to expand
the human ability"},{"time":349918,"text":"to sense and respond to our environments,"},{"time":352117,"text":"both physical and virtual."},{"time":354292,"text":"There's a new frontier: touch."},{"time":357545,"text":"And it has the power to change
how we all see the world around us."}]},{"cues":[{"time":361325,"text":"Thank you."}]},{"cues":[{"time":362531,"text":"(Applause)"}]}]}

speaker: M Jackson
title: How to grow your own glacier
text:
{"paragraphs":[{"cues":[{"time":6904,"text":"In the 13th Century,"},{"time":8444,"text":"Genghis Khan embarked on a mission
to take over Eurasia,"},{"time":12474,"text":"swiftly conquering countries and drawing 
them into his expanding Mongol Empire."},{"time":18234,"text":"With his vast armies he became almost 
unstoppable."},{"time":21761,"text":"But, legend has it that there was 
one obstacle"},{"time":24501,"text":"that even the impressive Khan couldn’t 
overcome:"},{"time":27761,"text":"A towering wall of ice,"},{"time":30101,"text":"grown by locals across a mountain pass"},{"time":33161,"text":"to stop the Khan’s armies from 
invading their territory."}]},{"cues":[{"time":36961,"text":"No one knows how historically accurate 
that particular story is,"},{"time":41431,"text":"but remarkably, it draws on fact:"},{"time":44375,"text":"For centuries, in the Karakoram 
and Himalayan mountain ranges,"},{"time":48305,"text":"people have been growing glaciers 
and using these homemade bodies of ice"},{"time":52705,"text":"as sources of drinking water and 
irrigation for their crops."},{"time":56665,"text":"But before we get to that fascinating 
phenomenon,"},{"time":59385,"text":"it’s important to understand the 
difference between"},{"time":61955,"text":"glaciers that grow in the wild,"},{"time":64085,"text":"and those that humans create."}]},{"cues":[{"time":66475,"text":"In the wild,"},{"time":67375,"text":"glaciers require three conditions to grow:"},{"time":70105,"text":"Snowfall, cold temperatures, and time."},{"time":73855,"text":"First, a great deal of snow falls and 
accumulates."},{"time":77375,"text":"Cold temperatures then ensure that the 
stacked up snow"},{"time":80235,"text":"persists throughout the winter, spring, 
summer, and fall."},{"time":84325,"text":"Over the following years, decades, 
and centuries,"},{"time":87522,"text":"the pressure of the accumulated snow"},{"time":89732,"text":"transforms layers into highly compacted 
glacial ice."}]},{"cues":[{"time":94642,"text":"Artificially growing a glacier,"},{"time":96460,"text":"however, is completely different."},{"time":98630,"text":"At the confluence of three great 
mountain ranges,"},{"time":101880,"text":"the Himalayas, Karakoram, and Hindu Kush,"},{"time":105150,"text":"some local cultures have believed for
centuries that glaciers are alive."},{"time":110190,"text":"And what’s more,"},{"time":111230,"text":"that certain glaciers can have different 
genders including male and female."},{"time":116110,"text":"Local Glacier Growers ‘breed’ new glaciers
by grafting together—or marrying—"},{"time":121305,"text":"fragments of ice from male and 
female glaciers,"},{"time":124865,"text":"then covering them with charcoal, 
wheat husks, cloths, or willow branches"},{"time":129905,"text":"so they can reproduce."},{"time":131749,"text":"Under their protective coverings,"},{"time":133549,"text":"these glacierets transform into fully 
active glaciers"},{"time":137439,"text":"that grow each year with 
additional snowfall."},{"time":140609,"text":"Those then serve as lasting 
reserves of water"},{"time":143529,"text":"that farmers can use 
to irrigate their crops."}]},{"cues":[{"time":146959,"text":"These practices have spread 
to other cultures,"},{"time":149159,"text":"where people are creating their own 
versions of glaciers"},{"time":151949,"text":"and applying them to solve serious 
modern challenges around water supplies."},{"time":157049,"text":"Take Ladakh, a high-altitude desert region
in northern India."},{"time":161688,"text":"It sits in the rain shadow of the 
Himalayas"},{"time":164266,"text":"and receives on average fewer than ten 
centimeters of rain per year."},{"time":168926,"text":"As local glaciers shrink because 
of climate change,"},{"time":171755,"text":"regional water scarcity is increasing."},{"time":174385,"text":"And so, local people have started growing 
their own glaciers"},{"time":177805,"text":"as insurance against this uncertainty."},{"time":180415,"text":"These glaciers come in two types: 
horizontal, and vertical."}]},{"cues":[{"time":184815,"text":"Horizontal glaciers are formed when 
farmers redirect glacier meltwater"},{"time":189255,"text":"into channels and pipes,"},{"time":191041,"text":"then carefully siphon it off into a series
of basins made from stones and earth."},{"time":197161,"text":"Villagers minutely control the release of 
water into these reservoirs,"},{"time":201575,"text":"waiting for each new layer to freeze"},{"time":203798,"text":"before filling the basin 
with another wave."},{"time":206848,"text":"In early spring,"},{"time":208108,"text":"these frozen pools begin to melt,"},{"time":210558,"text":"supplying villagers with 
irrigation for their fields."}]},{"cues":[{"time":213878,"text":"Local people make vertical glaciers using 
the meltwater"},{"time":217188,"text":"from already-existing glaciers 
high above their villages."},{"time":221368,"text":"The meltwater enters channels 
that run downhill,"},{"time":224683,"text":"flowing until it reaches a crop site"},{"time":226613,"text":"where it bursts forth from a pipe pointing
straight into the air."},{"time":230873,"text":"When winter temperatures dip,"},{"time":232663,"text":"this water freezes as it arcs 
out of the pipe,"},{"time":235783,"text":"ultimately forming a 50 meter ice 
sculpture called a stupa,"},{"time":240263,"text":"shaped like an upside-down ice cream cone."},{"time":243204,"text":"This inverted form minimizes the amount
of surface area it exposes to the sun"},{"time":248604,"text":"in the spring and summer."},{"time":250037,"text":"That ensures that the mini-glacier 
melts slowly"},{"time":253127,"text":"and provides a reliable supply of water 
to feed the farmers’ crops."}]},{"cues":[{"time":258077,"text":"These methods may be ancient,"},{"time":259997,"text":"but they’re becoming more relevant"},{"time":261617,"text":"as climate change takes its 
toll on our planet."},{"time":264767,"text":"In fact, people are now growing their own
glaciers in many regions beyond Ladakh."},{"time":270142,"text":"Swiss people, utilizing modern glacier 
growing technology,"},{"time":273632,"text":"created their first stupa in 2016 
in the Swiss Alps."},{"time":278082,"text":"There are plans for over 100 more in 
villages in Pakistan,"},{"time":282326,"text":"Kazakhstan, and Kyrgyzstan."},{"time":285335,"text":"Perhaps one day we’ll be able to harness
our homegrown glaciers"},{"time":289115,"text":"well enough to build whole walls of ice–"},{"time":291895,"text":"this time not for keeping people out,"},{"time":294285,"text":"but to enable life in some of the planet’s
harshest landscapes."}]}]}

speaker: Helen Marriage
title: Public art that turns cities into playgrounds of the imagination
text:
{"paragraphs":[{"cues":[{"time":1095,"text":"We live in a world
increasingly tyrannized by the screen,"},{"time":5708,"text":"by our phones, by our tablets,
by our televisions and our computers."},{"time":9664,"text":"We can have any experience that we want,"},{"time":11991,"text":"but feel nothing."},{"time":13651,"text":"We can have as many friends as we want,"},{"time":15598,"text":"but have nobody to shake hands with."}]},{"cues":[{"time":19667,"text":"I want to take you
to a different kind of world,"},{"time":21963,"text":"the world of the imagination,"},{"time":23622,"text":"where, using this most powerful
tool that we have,"},{"time":27871,"text":"we can transform both
our physical surroundings,"},{"time":31089,"text":"but in doing so, we can change
forever how we feel"},{"time":35164,"text":"and how we feel about the people
that we share the planet with."}]},{"cues":[{"time":39872,"text":"My company, Artichoke,
which I cofounded in 2006,"},{"time":44336,"text":"was set up to create moments."},{"time":46853,"text":"We all have moments in our lives,
and when we're on our deathbeds,"},{"time":50115,"text":"we're not going to remember
the daily commute to work"},{"time":52663,"text":"on the number 38 bus"},{"time":53842,"text":"or our struggle to find a parking space
every day when we go to the shop."},{"time":57674,"text":"We're going to remember those moments
when our kid took their first step"},{"time":61108,"text":"or when we got picked
for the football team"},{"time":63500,"text":"or when we fell in love."},{"time":65412,"text":"So Artichoke exists to create
moving, ephemeral moments"},{"time":69723,"text":"that transform the physical world
using the imagination of the artist"},{"time":73929,"text":"to show us what is possible."},{"time":77716,"text":"We create beauty amongst ruins."},{"time":80474,"text":"We reexamine our history."},{"time":82420,"text":"We create moments to which
everyone is invited,"},{"time":85125,"text":"either to witness or to take part."}]},{"cues":[{"time":89246,"text":"It all started for me
way back in the 1990s,"},{"time":91673,"text":"when I was appointed as festival director
in the tiny British city of Salisbury."},{"time":96448,"text":"You'll probably have heard of it."},{"time":98373,"text":"Here's the Salisbury Cathedral,
and here's the nearby Stonehenge Monument,"},{"time":102340,"text":"which is world-famous."},{"time":104114,"text":"Salisbury is a city that's been dominated
for hundreds of years by the Church,"},{"time":108432,"text":"the Conservative Party"},{"time":109740,"text":"and the army."},{"time":111852,"text":"It's a place where people
really love to observe the rules."},{"time":115552,"text":"So picture me on my first
year in the city,"},{"time":118536,"text":"cycling the wrong way
down a one-way street, late."},{"time":121735,"text":"I'm always late."},{"time":122916,"text":"It's a wonder I've even turned up today."}]},{"cues":[{"time":125091,"text":"(Laughter)"}]},{"cues":[{"time":126649,"text":"A little old lady on the sidewalk
helpfully shouted at me,"},{"time":129576,"text":""My dear, you're going the wrong way!""}]},{"cues":[{"time":131863,"text":"Charmingly -- I thought --
I said, "Yeah, I know.""}]},{"cues":[{"time":134602,"text":""I hope you die!" she screamed."}]},{"cues":[{"time":136608,"text":"(Laughter)"}]},{"cues":[{"time":137832,"text":"And I realized that this was a place
where I was in trouble."},{"time":141164,"text":"And yet, a year later,"},{"time":144017,"text":"persuasion, negotiation --
everything I could deploy --"},{"time":147971,"text":"saw me producing the work."},{"time":149940,"text":"Not a classical concert in a church
or a poetry reading,"},{"time":153530,"text":"but the work of a French
street theater company"},{"time":155747,"text":"who were telling the story of Faust,"},{"time":157526,"text":""Mephistomania," on stilts,
complete with handheld pyrotechnics."}]},{"cues":[{"time":162051,"text":"The day after, the same little old lady
stopped me in the street and said,"},{"time":165964,"text":""Were you responsible for last night?""}]},{"cues":[{"time":169461,"text":"I backed away."}]},{"cues":[{"time":170968,"text":"(Laughter)"}]},{"cues":[{"time":172809,"text":""Yes.""}]},{"cues":[{"time":174963,"text":""When I heard about it," she said,
"I knew it wasn't for me."},{"time":178165,"text":"But Helen, my dear, it was.""}]},{"cues":[{"time":181317,"text":"So what had happened?"},{"time":182666,"text":"Curiosity had triumphed over suspicion,"},{"time":185440,"text":"and delight had banished anxiety."}]},{"cues":[{"time":188574,"text":"So I wondered how one could transfer
these ideas to a larger stage"},{"time":195107,"text":"and started on a journey
to do the same kind of thing to London."},{"time":199699,"text":"Imagine: it's a world city."},{"time":201587,"text":"Like all our cities, it's dedicated
to toil, trade and traffic."},{"time":205625,"text":"It's a machine to get you
to work on time and back,"},{"time":208469,"text":"and we're all complicit in wanting
the routines to be fixed"},{"time":212805,"text":"and for everybody to be able to know
what's going to happen next."},{"time":216840,"text":"And yet, what if this amazing city
could be turned into a stage,"},{"time":221362,"text":"a platform for something so unimaginable"},{"time":224395,"text":"that would somehow
transform people's lives?"},{"time":227652,"text":"We do these things often in Britain."},{"time":229424,"text":"I'm sure you do them wherever you're from."},{"time":231495,"text":"Here's Horse Guards Parade."},{"time":233198,"text":"And here's something that we do often.
It's always about winning things."},{"time":236627,"text":"It's about the marathon or winning a war"},{"time":238704,"text":"or a triumphant cricket team coming home."},{"time":240760,"text":"We close the streets. Everybody claps."},{"time":243416,"text":"But for theater? Not possible."}]},{"cues":[{"time":246408,"text":"Except a story told by a French company:"},{"time":250403,"text":"a saga about a little girl
and a giant elephant"},{"time":253965,"text":"that came to visit"},{"time":256288,"text":"for four days."},{"time":257668,"text":"And all I had to do was persuade
the public authorities"},{"time":260705,"text":"that shutting the city for four days
was something completely normal."}]},{"cues":[{"time":264326,"text":"(Laughter)"}]},{"cues":[{"time":265741,"text":"No traffic, just people
enjoying themselves,"},{"time":269503,"text":"coming out to marvel and witness
this extraordinary artistic endeavor"},{"time":273427,"text":"by the French theater
company Royal de Luxe."}]},{"cues":[{"time":276377,"text":"It was a seven-year journey,"},{"time":278440,"text":"with me saying to a group of men --
almost always men -- sitting in a room,"},{"time":283220,"text":""Eh, it's like a fairy story with
a little girl and this giant elephant,"},{"time":288567,"text":"and they come to town for four days"},{"time":290941,"text":"and everybody gets
to come and watch and play.""},{"time":294709,"text":"And they would go,"},{"time":296586,"text":""Why would we do this?"},{"time":299255,"text":"Is it for something?"},{"time":301409,"text":"Is it celebrating a presidential visit?"},{"time":303537,"text":"Is it the Entente Cordiale
between France and England?"},{"time":306375,"text":"Is it for charity?
Are you trying to raise money?""},{"time":309343,"text":"And I'd say,"},{"time":311794,"text":""None of these things.""},{"time":313866,"text":"And they'd say, "Why would we do this?""}]},{"cues":[{"time":317393,"text":"But after four years, this magic trick,
this extraordinary thing happened."},{"time":321053,"text":"I was sitting in the same meeting
I'd been to for four years,"},{"time":323956,"text":"saying, "Please, please, may I?""},{"time":325542,"text":"Instead of which, I didn't say, "Please.""},{"time":327581,"text":"I said, "This thing that we've
been talking about for such a long time,"},{"time":331806,"text":"it's happening on these dates,"},{"time":334044,"text":"and I really need you to help me.""},{"time":336690,"text":"This magic thing happened."},{"time":338253,"text":"Everybody in the room somehow decided
that somebody else had said yes."}]},{"cues":[{"time":342828,"text":"(Laughter)"}]},{"cues":[{"time":344970,"text":"(Applause)"}]},{"cues":[{"time":349675,"text":"They decided that they were not
being asked to take responsibility,"},{"time":354028,"text":"or maybe the bus planning manager
was being asked to take responsibility"},{"time":357536,"text":"for planning the bus diversions,"},{"time":359565,"text":"and the council officer
was being asked to close the roads,"},{"time":363941,"text":"and the transport for London people were
being asked to sort out the Underground."},{"time":367776,"text":"All these people were only being asked
to do the thing that they could do"},{"time":371261,"text":"that would help us."},{"time":372642,"text":"Nobody was being asked
to take responsibility."},{"time":374902,"text":"And I, in my innocence, thought,
"Well, I'll take responsibility,""},{"time":379201,"text":"for what turned out to be
a million people on the street."}]},{"cues":[{"time":383510,"text":"It was our first show."}]},{"cues":[{"time":384929,"text":"(Applause)"}]},{"cues":[{"time":389262,"text":"It was our first show, and it changed
the nature of the appreciation of culture,"},{"time":394247,"text":"not in a gallery, not in a theater,
not in an opera house,"},{"time":397521,"text":"but live and on the streets,"},{"time":399547,"text":"transforming public space
for the broadest possible audience,"},{"time":403126,"text":"people who would never
buy a ticket to see anything."}]},{"cues":[{"time":405995,"text":"So there we were."},{"time":407200,"text":"We'd finished, and we've continued
to produce work of this kind."},{"time":412644,"text":"As you can see, the company's
work is astonishing,"},{"time":415940,"text":"but what's also astonishing is the fact
that permission was granted."},{"time":422654,"text":"And you don't see any security."},{"time":425282,"text":"And this was nine months
after terrible terrorist bombings"},{"time":428725,"text":"that had ripped London apart."}]},{"cues":[{"time":430696,"text":"So I began to wonder
whether it was possible"},{"time":432887,"text":"to do this kind of stuff
in even more complicated circumstances."},{"time":437078,"text":"We turned our attention
to Northern Ireland,"},{"time":439828,"text":"the North of Ireland,
depending on your point of view."},{"time":442444,"text":"This is a map of England,
Scotland, Wales and Ireland,"},{"time":446777,"text":"the island to the left."},{"time":448829,"text":"For generations,
it's been a place of conflict,"},{"time":451649,"text":"the largely Catholic republic in the south"},{"time":454706,"text":"and the largely Protestant
loyalist community --"},{"time":458383,"text":"hundreds of years of conflict,"},{"time":461530,"text":"British troops on the streets
for over 30 years."},{"time":464518,"text":"And now, although
there is a peace process,"},{"time":467530,"text":"this is today in this city, called
Londonderry if you're a loyalist,"},{"time":471622,"text":"called Derry if you're a Catholic."},{"time":475753,"text":"But everybody calls it home."},{"time":477779,"text":"And I began to wonder"},{"time":478986,"text":"whether there was a way in which
the community tribalism could be addressed"},{"time":483538,"text":"through art and the imagination."}]},{"cues":[{"time":486770,"text":"This is what the communities do,"},{"time":488335,"text":"every summer, each community."},{"time":489933,"text":"This is a bonfire filled
with effigies and insignia"},{"time":493963,"text":"from the people that they hate
on the other side."},{"time":496450,"text":"This is the same
from the loyalist community."},{"time":499435,"text":"And every summer, they burn them."},{"time":503784,"text":"They're right in the center of town."}]},{"cues":[{"time":505553,"text":"So we turned to here,
to the Nevada desert, to Burning Man,"},{"time":509862,"text":"where people also do bonfires,"},{"time":511414,"text":"but with a completely
different set of values."},{"time":514291,"text":"Here you see the work of David Best
and his extraordinary temples,"},{"time":519159,"text":"which are built during
the Burning Man event"},{"time":522247,"text":"and then incinerated on the Sunday."}]},{"cues":[{"time":524888,"text":"So we invited him
and his community to come,"},{"time":527656,"text":"and we recruited from both sides
of the political and religious divide:"},{"time":532475,"text":"young people, unemployed people,"},{"time":534391,"text":"people who would never
normally come across each other"},{"time":537127,"text":"or speak to each other."},{"time":538709,"text":"And out of their extraordinary
work rose a temple"},{"time":542543,"text":"to rival the two cathedrals
that exist in the town,"},{"time":545885,"text":"one Catholic and one Protestant."},{"time":548035,"text":"But this was a temple to no religion,"},{"time":551236,"text":"for everyone,"},{"time":552641,"text":"for no community, but for everyone."},{"time":555625,"text":"And we put it in this place
where everyone told me nobody would come."},{"time":558909,"text":"It was too dangerous.
It sat between two communities."},{"time":561466,"text":"I just kept saying,
"But it's got such a great view.""}]},{"cues":[{"time":563976,"text":"(Laughter)"}]},{"cues":[{"time":566000,"text":"And again, that same old question:"},{"time":567688,"text":"Why wouldn't we do this?"}]},{"cues":[{"time":569434,"text":"What you see in the picture"},{"time":570771,"text":"is the beginning of 426
primary school children"},{"time":573655,"text":"who were walked up the hill
by the head teacher,"},{"time":576424,"text":"who didn't want them
to lose this opportunity."},{"time":579251,"text":"And just as happens in the Nevada desert,"},{"time":581685,"text":"though in slightly different temperatures,"},{"time":584178,"text":"the people of this community,
65,000 of them,"},{"time":587915,"text":"turned out to write their grief,
their pain, their hope,"},{"time":593296,"text":"their hopes for the future,"},{"time":595107,"text":"their love."},{"time":596319,"text":"Because in the end,
this is only about love."}]},{"cues":[{"time":599032,"text":"They live in a post-conflict society:"},{"time":601629,"text":"lots of post-traumatic stress,"},{"time":603783,"text":"high suicide."},{"time":604992,"text":"And yet, for this brief moment --"},{"time":607101,"text":"and it would be ridiculous to assume
that it was more than that --"},{"time":610296,"text":"somebody like Kevin -- a Catholic
whose father was shot when he was nine,"},{"time":614806,"text":"upstairs in bed --"},{"time":617189,"text":"Kevin came to work as a volunteer."},{"time":619168,"text":"And he was the first person to embrace
the elderly Protestant lady"},{"time":622861,"text":"who came through the door on the day
we opened the temple to the public."},{"time":628185,"text":"It rose up. It sat there for five days."},{"time":631221,"text":"And then we chose -- from our little tiny
band of nonsectarian builders,"},{"time":637138,"text":"who had given us their lives
for this period of months"},{"time":640276,"text":"to make this extraordinary thing --"},{"time":643788,"text":"we chose from them the people
who would incinerate it."}]},{"cues":[{"time":647926,"text":"And here you see the moment when,"},{"time":650682,"text":"witnessed by 15,000 people who turned out
on a dark, cold, March evening,"},{"time":657532,"text":"the moment when they decided
to put their enmity behind them,"},{"time":663444,"text":"to inhabit this shared space,"},{"time":667369,"text":"where everybody had an opportunity
to say the things that had been unsayable,"},{"time":672190,"text":"to say out loud,"},{"time":673423,"text":""You hurt me and my family,
but I forgive you.""},{"time":676704,"text":"And together, they watched"},{"time":680416,"text":"as members of their community let go
of this thing that was so beautiful,"},{"time":685394,"text":"but was as hard to let go of"},{"time":688077,"text":"as those thoughts and feelings"},{"time":691063,"text":"that had gone into making it."}]},{"cues":[{"time":695163,"text":"(Music)"}]},{"cues":[{"time":705487,"text":"Thank you."}]},{"cues":[{"time":706964,"text":"(Applause)"}]}]}
